%% version 2006/05/20 or later.
%% 
%% 
%% This is a minimal example of using the uefcsthesis class.
%% This generates an English MSc thesis with one-sided layout.
%% To compile, use either lualatex or xelatex, for example,
%% $ lualatex minimal_modern.en.tex
%% $ biber minimal_modern.en
%% $ lualatex minimal_modern.en.tex
%% or use latexmk:
%% $ latexmk -lualatex minimal_modern.en.tex
%%
\documentclass[mscthesis,english,oneside,biblatex]{uefcsthesis}
\usepackage{datetime}

\usepackage{acro}
\newdateformat{monthYearDateFormat}{\monthname[\THEMONTH] \THEYEAR} % The month and year of handing in your thesis

%% Correct the below with the name of your bibliography file
\addbibresource{references.bib}

%% Replace all capital text with your own information.
\title{FREQUENT ITEMSET MINING IN REDESCRIPTION MINING} % Title of the thesis
\author{VIET}{TA} % Your name
\date{\monthYearDateFormat\today}
\city{JOENSUU} % Either Kuopio or Joensuu
\firstsupervisor{Pauli Miettinen} % Name of the first supervisor
\secondsupervisor{Esther Galbrun} % Name of the second supervisor, if any
\keywords{DATA MINING\sep REDESCRIPTION MINING\sep FREQUENT ITEMSET MINING\sep APRIORI \sep ECLAT} % Keywords must be separated with \sep

%% To get the ACM CCS classification, you can visit
%% https://dl.acm.org/ccs/ccs.cfm
%% There you can find a tool to generate LaTeX code for the classification
%% Copy it here. You don't need to copy the XML at the begin, though.
%% For example,
%% \ccsdesc[500]{Some Class}

\input{auxiliaries/acronyms.tex}
\input{auxiliaries/commands.tex}

\begin{document}
\maketitle
\begin{abstract}
  \input{contents/abstract.tex}
\end{abstract}

\frontmatter

\printacronyms[%
  name = {Abbreviations},
  sort = false,
]

\tableofcontents
\mainmatter

\input{contents/body.tex}

%% Next comes the references
\printbibliography[heading=bibintoc]

\backmatter % Do not remove!
%% Possible appendices come here
\end{document}
\endinput
%%
%% End of file `minimal_modern.en.tex'.
